items.title: Dow layoffs: Chemicals maker to slash 4,500 jobs amid sluggish demand — here's what we know
items.summary: Dow plans to cut 4,500 jobs, about 13% of its workforce, to enhance profitability by $2 billion, while projecting lower first-quarter revenue. Shares fell 3% as global chemical firms reassess strategies amid weak demand and rising costs.

items.summary: The Survey proposes expanding the national Tele-MANAS programme beyond crisis counselling to actively address digital addiction

items.title: Economic Survey 2025-26: Urban land dead capital, must be used well
items.summary: The Survey highlights that land-use restrictions and ambiguity about land titles may be causing urban land to become “dead capital”

items.title: Economic Survey 2025-26 projects 6.8–7.2% GDP growth; industry leaders welcome outlook
items.summary: Economic Survey 2025-26: Industry leaders and economic experts on Thursday welcomed the Economic Survey 2025-26, describing it as a pragmatic assessment of India's macroeconomic stability.

items.title: Stray Dogs Case: 3-judge SC bench reserves decision on issue of strays across country
items.summary: The verdict on the relocation of the stray dogs to shelters in Delhi-NCR sparked an uproar from several quarters of society and was later modified by the three-judge Bench.

items.title: Economic Survey 2025 shows India in bright light in an  increasingly darker world
items.summary: The Economic Survey 2025-26 has upgraded its medium-term outlook for India’s growth to 7%, but has also said it could be impacted by an increasingly grim global outlook

items.title: How India’s informal watchdogs are forcing consumer brands to clean up their act
items.summary: They have no connection with each other, but together, a motley band of independent watchdogs, influencers, online communities, and third-party platforms has kindled a consumer awakening across India.

items.title: India to cut food weighting in CPI in new inflation series
items.summary: India is set to revise its inflation measurement, significantly reducing food's weight in the Consumer Price Index to 36.75%. This shift aims to stabilize inflation readings, impacting monetary policy. The updated basket will reflect current spending, incorporating rural rents and e-commerce prices for a more accurate economic picture.

items.summary: ITC Q3 results: Net profit remains flat at  ₹5018 crore; revenue up 6.7%, announces interim dividend  ₹6.50 per share

items.summary: The Survey noted that India’s concert economy is nascent, but its scaling up

items.summary: The move is part of the ongoing structural reforms in the mining sector and in line with the vision of Aatmanirbhar Bharat and Viksit Bharat 2047, Coal Ministry said

items.summary: Import substitution alone insufficient in a world of volatile capital and supply chains

items.title: Montra Electric delivers India’s first ‘PM E-DRIVE’ certified electric truck
items.summary: Montra Electric has delivered the electric heavy truck, Rhino 5538 EV 6x4 Tractor trailer, to UltraTech Cement

items.title: Current pilot-aircraft ratio 'adequate' at domestic airlines: Government
items.summary: The civil aviation ministry has deemed the current pilot-aircraft ratio at domestic airlines "adequate," despite recent IndiGo disruptions linked to flight duty norm compliance. The DGCA mandates three crew sets per aircraft, with airlines conducting periodic reviews to ensure operational stability and pilot well-being. IndiGo has assured sufficient crew by February 2026.

items.title: ITC Q3 Results: Cons PAT flat at Rs 4,931 crore, revenue up 7%; Rs 6.50 per share dividend announced
items.summary: ITC Q3 Results: FMCG major ITC's December quarter consolidated net profit stood at Rs 4,931 crore, flat compared to Rs 4,935 crore reported in the year ago period.

items.title: Investment of Rs 13,700 crore takes up mobile phone production of Rs 9.34 lakh crore: Economic Survey
items.summary: India's electronics sector is booming. A mobile manufacturing incentive scheme has spurred massive production and exports. Electronics production grew significantly in FY'25, with exports also rising sharply. The sector is on track to become a top export category. Mobile manufacturing has seen a huge jump. India is also focusing on semiconductors to build domestic capacity and reduce import reliance.

items.title: Welfare, pay revision weigh on Kerala’s pre-poll budget with deficit of ₹1,773 cr
items.summary: Kerala Budget envisages additional expenditure of ₹1,350 cr with no related resource mobilisation

items.title: Dabur Q3 Results: Cons PAT grows 7% YoY to Rs 560 crore, revenue up 6%
items.summary: Dabur India posted a 7% rise in Q3 profit and 6% revenue growth, led by FMCG expansion, strong India market share gains and double-digit international growth. Sequential profits jumped sharply, underscoring resilient demand, brand strength and broad-based category performance.

items.title: CEA warns of fragile global outlook in 2026, sees rising risk of disorder
items.summary: CEA suggests that adverse outcomes can no longer be treated as tail risks

items.title: Quess Corp Q3 Results: PAT rises 32% to Rs 55 crore
items.summary: Staffing and workforce solutions provider Quess Corp reported a 32 per cent year-on-year rise in consolidated net profit to Rs 55.09 crore for the quarter ended December 31, 2025.

items.title: KPIT Tech Q3 Results: Net profit plunges 29% to Rs 133 crore; revenue up 9% to Rs 1,617 crore
items.summary: Mobility and automotive solutions company KPIT Technologies on Thursday reported a 28.7 per cent decline in consolidated net profit to Rs 133.30 crore for the December quarter, primarily weighed down by a one-time statutory impact related to new labour codes.

items.title: Cupid Q3 results: Net profits surge 196% YoY to  ₹33 crore; 4:1 bonus issue announced — Details here
items.summary: Cupid Q3 results: Net profits surge 196% YoY to  ₹33 crore; 4:1 bonus issue announced — Details here

items.title: ATR, Fly91 ink maintenance agreement
items.summary: Fly91, a pure play regional airline, currently operates four ATR 72‑600s, with two more scheduled to arrive arriving in early 2026

items.title: Economic Survey calls for strengthening India's long-term debt market
items.summary: India’s Economic Survey has underlined the urgent need to strengthen long-term capital markets to support infrastructure development and climate-related investments. The report flags shallow corporate bond markets, underdeveloped municipal bonds, and the risk-averse nature of institutional investors as key challenges. It recommends measures such as rationalising tax treatment for debt instruments and strengthening credit enhancement mechanisms to deepen market participation and improve maturity profiles.

items.title: Kerala shows the way in integrating RE in grid
items.summary: To enable effective integration with the grid the Kerala State Electricity Board (KSEB) now requires new connected households, as well as industrial and agricultural solar plants, to install battery storage capacities

items.title: Honest officials must be protected from vexatious prosecution: Economic Survey
items.summary: The Economic Survey 2025-26 advocates for protecting honest officials from vexatious prosecution to foster an entrepreneurial state in India. It calls for legal frameworks to safeguard good-faith decision-making, distinguishing errors from corruption, and re-orienting agencies like the CAG to prioritize learning over blame.

items.title: FINAL FOR PRINT: Cross-subsidies in railway traffic, power distribution needs to be addressed: Economic Survey
items.summary: Due to cross-subsidisation, high freight rates distort competition with roads, inflating commodity and consumer prices, as well as logistics costs, stated the Economic Survey that was tabled in Parliament on Thursday

items.title: Voltas Q3 Results: Profit slumps 35% to Rs 84 crore, revenue dips marginally
items.summary: Leading air-conditioning maker and engineering services provider Voltas Ltd on Thursday reported a 35.4 per cent decline in its consolidated net profit to Rs 84.46 crore for the December quarter of FY26.

items.title: Economic Survey reflects healthy fundamentals, robust reforms across sectors: FM Sitharaman
items.summary: FM Nirmala Sitharaman said the Economic Survey 2025-26 reflects the healthy banking fundamentals, achieved due to the various banking reforms undertaken by Prime Minister Narendra Modi's government in the last decade.

items.title: SHANTI Act enables private sector participation in equipment manufacturing, R&D
items.summary: The SHANTI Act updates India’s nuclear legal framework, including the Atomic Energy Act of 1962 and the Civil Liability for Nuclear Damage Act of 2010, to permit private sector and state government participation previously banned by the 1962 Act, as per the Economic Survey for FY26

items.title: Economic Survey calls for activity-based regulation to curb arbitrage and boost financial stability
items.summary: The Economic Survey advocates for a shift from entity-based to activity-based regulations, focusing on transaction risk and function to prevent regulatory arbitrage. This approach aims to foster a diversified financial ecosystem where banks, NBFCs, fintechs, and market lenders compete on a level playing field, ensuring systemic stability and promoting innovation.

items.title: Blue Star Q3 profit plunges 39% on Labour Code impact
items.summary: The air conditioning and refrigeration company’s consolidated revenue grew modestly by 4.2 per cent to ₹2,925.31 crore

items.title: VCA Group’s steady rise in Shivaji Park is built on discipline, quality and trust
items.summary: In Mumbai's evolving real estate market, VCA Group prioritizes discipline and consistent execution over speed.  Their focus on regulatory clarity, construction excellence, and long-term vision, particularly evident in Shivaji Park, has solidified their reputation.  Active leadership ensures quality and timely delivery, building trust through proven reliability.

items.title: Small businesses still turn to friends, moneylenders for loans, says Economic Survey
items.summary: Micro and unincorporated enterprises still rely heavily informal sources like friends and moneylenders for small-ticket loans, even as formal sources of credit have improved for large loans.

items.title: Economic Survey 2025: will NSIL pick up the slack of a flat space budget?
items.summary: The gap between what the industry wants and what the Department of Space needs has never been wider

items.title: SMFG India Credit partners with Google for collateral-free loans via GPay
items.summary: Through this collaboration, loans will be disbursed in minutes to eligible Google Pay users who apply for a loan through the app

items.title: Gainers & Losers: Hindustan Copper, Vedanta among 6 stocks in focus on Thursday
items.summary: Indian markets rose for a third day, led by financials and energy. Hindustan Copper hit a record, L&T and Vedanta gained, eClerx jumped on results, while BEL slipped on brokerage views and Five-Star fell after earnings pressure elsewhere persisted modestly.

items.title: Financial sector regulators must walk the tightrope to balance growth with stability: Economic Survey
items.summary: Significant improvement has been observed in the asset quality of scheduled commercial banks (SCBs), as evidenced by their Gross Non-Performing Assets (GNPA) ratio standing at 2.2% and net NPA ratio at 0.5% in September 2025, having reached a multi-decadal low level and record low level, respectively.

items.title: Reliance Industries to buy up to 150,000 bpd of Russian oil from February
items.summary: Reliance Industries will purchase up to 150,000 barrels per day of Russian oil starting in February for its domestic market refinery. This follows a pause and a U.S. concession that allowed winding down dealings with sanctioned producer Rosneft. Reliance will source from non-sanctioned sellers as it diversifies supply.

items.title: With rise in production, India looks at expansion of seaweed cultivation
items.summary: India is poised for a major expansion in seaweed cultivation and seaweed-based industries, with the sector identified as a key driver of sustainable livelihoods and coastal development

items.title: Economic Survey calls for 20-year city plans for all million-plus cities
items.summary: India's Economic Survey for 2025-26 proposes mandatory 20-year city plans for urban centers. These plans will focus on transport, housing, and land value capture. The survey highlights cities as economic engines and calls for integrated planning. It notes progress in urban infrastructure and housing schemes. Future policy will prioritize dynamic, inclusive, and sustainable cities.

items.title: Swadeshi inevitable as Economic Survey 2026 calls for disciplined self-reliance
items.summary: The Economic Survey 2026 says Swadeshi is inevitable as global export controls, technology curbs and trade barriers end the era of naive globalisation. It calls for disciplined self-reliance to reduce external vulnerabilities while strengthening competitiveness and long-term economic resilience.

items.title: Piramal Pharma Q3 Results: Co reports loss as CDMO slowdown drags revenue
items.summary: Piramal Pharma swung to a Rs 136 crore Q3 loss as revenue fell 3%, hit by CDMO destocking, weak US biopharma funding, trade uncertainty and regulatory delays. Management sees recovery signs, cost controls cushioning EBITDA, and expects a stronger Q4.

items.title: Rs 180 Dividend Stock: BSE 500 firm declares cash reward for shareholders - Check record date
items.summary: Gillette India announced an interim dividend of Rs 180 per equity share, which includes a one-time special dividend of Rs 60 per share for the financial year 2025-26.

items.title: Chemical stock jumps over 4% from today's low following stock market rebound. Do you own?
items.summary: Sudarshan Pharma shares surged nearly 4% to  ₹20.25 after reporting Q3FY26 revenue of  ₹158.37 crore, a 37% YoY increase. Net profit rose 56% to  ₹43.05 crore. Despite a 27.40% drop in January, the stock shows a strong long-term gain of 165%.

items.title: US slams Europe for ‘mother of all deals’ with India, says it undermines Ukraine war efforts
items.summary: US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent pointed out that while India had begun buying sanctioned Russian oil, European countries later purchased refined products, effectively funding the conflict.

items.title: KPIT Tech revenues at $181 million in Q3 FY26, its 22nd straight quarter of revenue growth
items.summary: AI-infused mobility solutions, strong deal wins lift numbers

items.title: Economic Survey 2026: Rail track commissioning more than doubles since 2014
items.summary: The Indian Railways is undergoing a remarkable transformation, with the pace of new track commissioning soaring since 2014. High capital investments are funneled into expanding the network and refurbishing older lines. The introduction of dedicated freight corridors is significantly alleviating congestion, allowing for quicker transit times. Meanwhile, expansive station redevelopment projects are reshaping travel hubs nationwide.

items.title: Motorola introduces Moto G77, G67 with 108MP camera, AMOLED display and military-grade durability
items.summary: Motorola Moto G77 & G67 Introduced: Lenovo company-owned Motorola has introduced two new models in the Moto G family – the Moto G77 and Moto G67 – in the global market. These mid‑tier smartphones, according to the company, come with vivid displays, intelligent camera systems, and military-grade durability. Check details:

items.title: Union Budget 2026: Big announcements, no major tax relief? Here's what brokerages say
items.summary: Union Budget 2026 is expected to stay focused on fiscal discipline and growth led spending, with brokerages signalling that broad based tax relief for the middle class is unlikely. Defence, capital expenditure and targeted policy announcements are seen as the key drivers for markets and the economy.

items.title: After Europe pacts, India eyes Chile, Canada for next trade deals: Report
items.summary: India has rapidly secured three free trade pacts across Europe. Talks are progressing with Chile and Canada. Agreements with Asean nations are improving. Discussions are also ongoing with Israel and the Gulf Cooperation Council. India is also exploring trade with the Mercosur bloc.

items.title: Economic Survey 2025-26 bats for 26% government shareholding in PSUs
items.summary: The Economic Survey 2025-26 suggests a radical shift in how state-run companies are defined and divested.

items.title: India should think less on tariffs, more on opportunities to boost trade: World Bank's Ajay Banga
items.summary: World Bank President Ajay Banga urged India to prioritize trade opportunities over tariffs. He highlighted India's extensive trade pacts, including the recent India-EU free trade agreement. Banga noted the significant growth of emerging markets in global trade over the past two decades. This new deal will boost trade between India and the European Union.

items.title: From Rs 3 Lakh to 4 Lakh in 10 Days: Silver rally signals rising global risks, says Economic Survey
items.summary: The white metal’s fastest-ever Rs 1-lakh surge in six weeks mirrors investor caution amid rising geopolitical and financial uncertainty, says the Economic Survey 2025–26.

items.title: For every international student coming to India, 28 Indian students went abroad
items.summary: India needs to ramp up its ‘education-tourism’ strategy to attract more international students, as competition from neighbouring countries has increased.

items.title: India gets unintended trade edge in Turkiye from EU FTA: GTRI
items.summary: India's free trade agreement with the EU offers an unexpected advantage: Indian goods can now enter Turkiye duty-free via the EU. However, Turkish products cannot leverage the same pact for duty-free access into India, as only EU-origin goods qualify under the agreement's rules of origin.

items.title: Passenger fare hikes reduce Railways' dependence on freight: Economic Survey
items.summary: Indian Railways' freight earnings share is decreasing due to passenger fare adjustments. This trend is expected to continue. High freight rates impact competition and prices. Rationalising these rates could boost revenue and encourage rail transport. Freight loading shows strong momentum, supported by core sectors.

items.title: Hindustan Zinc OFS sees strong retail subscription of 2.3 times on Day 2
items.summary: Hindustan Zinc’s OFS drew strong interest, with the retail portion subscribed 2.3 times on Day 2 as investors bid for 1.10 crore shares against 47.58 lakh on offer. This followed a robust 142% non-retail subscription on Day 1, underscoring solid demand at the Rs 685 floor price despite the stock trading higher.

items.title: Budget 2026 and Real Estate: Time for long-term fixes, not short-term band-aids
items.summary: With the Union Budget 2026-27 on the horizon, the real estate landscape is buzzing with expectations for transformative reforms. Primary concerns revolve around making housing more accessible, ensuring taxation is straightforward, and speeding up project sanctioning processes. There’s a strong demand from buyers for increased deductions on housing loan interest.

items.title: India must build enduring national capabilities to navigate trade disruptions, geopolitical upheaval: Economic Survey
items.summary: India must prioritize building robust national capabilities and economic sovereignty amidst a global landscape of shrinking rule-based trade, rising protectionism, and weaponized resources. The Economic Survey highlights the need for strategic indispensability and learning without dependence to navigate a world where economic interdependence is increasingly viewed as a vulnerability, advocating for 'Swadeshi' as a crucial policy lever.

items.title: Economic Survey calls for long investment horizons in innovation, skills in private sector to support national goals
items.summary: Chief Economic Advisor V Anantha Nageswaran, Economic Survey 2026 calls the private sector to “marry commercial dynamism with conscious contribution to nation-building”, noting that they must recognize role in shaping social trust and institutional credibility.

items.title: India's macroeconomic fundamentals stronger than ever, successfully navigated global headwinds: Nirmala Sitharaman
items.summary: India's economy is performing strongly. Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman stated macroeconomic fundamentals are robust. The country has navigated global challenges. Potential GDP growth is now projected at 7 percent. The Economic Survey forecasts 6.8-7.2 percent growth for the next fiscal year. India remains the fastest-growing major economy.

items.title: Indian renewables firms urge pause on auctions as backlogs surge
items.summary: Renewable energy firms in India are asking the government to halt new project auctions. They want existing projects to find buyers first. Firms warn of more power output cuts if grid issues continue. Over 42 gigawatts of capacity are awaiting power supply contracts. Grids in Gujarat and Rajasthan are rejecting green power. This practice is known as curtailment.

items.title: 'Swadeshi' a legitimate policy instrument when trade is no longer reciprocal: CEA Nageswaran
Rosatom showcases nuclear technologies at Indian Energy Week
items.summary: Rosatom showcased its comprehensive nuclear energy solutions, including floating power units and SMRs, while inviting India to join a consortium for the powerful MBIR research reactor.  This collaboration aims to deepen ties in nuclear projects, medicine, and digital solutions, building on decades of partnership and the success of the Kudankulam plant.

items.title: How Economic Survey projections stack up against actual GDP growth
items.summary: The Economic Survey gives forecasts of how the economy is projected to grow in the next year. The estimates are often cautious and are given in the form of a range.

items.title: Economic Survey pegs global climate finance gap at $4 tn, says bond markets crucial to bridge it
items.summary: The Economic Survey 2025-26 highlights a $4 trillion financing gap for climate and sustainable development, particularly affecting developing economies. It emphasizes the need for better funding in critical areas like climate adaptation and urban infrastructure.

items.title: Boeing unfazed by India-EU FTA, says maintenance cost unlikely to decline soon
items.summary: Despite the India-EU FTA eliminating tariffs on aircraft parts, Boeing remains skeptical about significant cost reductions for maintenance in India. Airbus might see marginal advantages, but the focus remains on increasing aircraft deliveries to meet growing demand in the Indian market.

items.title: India's commercial aircraft fleet to triple by 2035: Airbus
items.summary: Addressing a press conference on the sidelines of Wings India 2026 in Hyderabad, Jurgen Westermeier, President and Managing Director, Airbus India and South Asia, said, "We are witnessing the centre of global aviation shift toward the east. India's fleet expansion will not only enhance domestic mobility but will position the country as a dominant hub for international transit. Therefore, the next chapter of Indian aviation must ensure its operating models evolve at the same pace as the expansion in its fleet and network."

items.title: Fertilizer, agtech sectors seek budget supporting resilient, self-reliant ecosystem
items.summary: Key expectations include promoting ‘residue-free, nutrient-rich’ farming as an integrated national agriculture and health policy

items.title: Economic Survey says change the definition of 'govt company'
items.summary: The Economic Survey 2025-26 proposes a new approach to disinvestment in central public sector enterprises. It suggests market-aligned stake dilution and governance reforms to unlock value. This strategy aims to redeploy public capital into future growth sectors. The survey also recommends rethinking ownership thresholds to enable deeper stake dilution. This move could boost receipts and support long-term growth.

items.title: Economic Survey highlights telecom PLI's big success
items.summary: Economic Survey 2025-26: Telecommunications is positioned as a “foundational backbone of the digital economy,” contributing directly about 1.2% to Gross Value Added (GVA), the survey said.

items.title: IEX Q3 Results: Cons net profit jumps 11% YoY to Rs 119 crore; co declares interim dividend
items.summary: Indian Energy Exchange posted an 11% YoY rise in consolidated Q3 profit to Rs 119 crore, driven by stronger revenue and higher trading volumes. The company declared a Rs 1.50 interim dividend. Revenue grew 14% YoY to Rs 183 crore, while power prices softened and IGX reported steady growth in gas-trading volumes.

items.title: RBI defers plan to mandate climate risk disclosures by banks, sources say
items.summary:
RBI's decision to hold off on issuing final ‌climate disclosure norms for Indian banks has not been previously
reported

items.title: Gold and silver soar as U.S. trust frays, warns Aswath Damodaran
items.summary: Aswath Damodaran argues 2025 market moves reflect a deep trust deficit in US institutions. Bonds stayed calm, the dollar weakened, gold and silver surged, while bitcoin failed to act as a haven, trading like a risky equity throughout the year.

items.title: SEA’s pre-Budget memorandum seeks policy interventions to protect domestic edible oil sector
items.summary: Stakeholders are looking for measures that strengthen farmer realisation, encourage domestic processing and value addition, ensure tax and trade neutrality, and reduce import dependence

items.title: Economic Survey 2026 sees silver lining in rupee weakness amid 50% Trump tariffs
items.summary: The Indian rupee breached the 92 per US dollar mark earlier today and settled the day near an all-time low at 91.96 as persistent selloff by foreign portfolio investors (FPIs) and risk-off sentiment weighed on the domestic unit.

items.title: ‘We must invest’, says IOC Chairman highlighting strategic investment and global partnerships for India's energy sector
items.summary: The IOC Chairman explained that the $500 billion opportunity spans across multiple sectors, including exploration, refineries, petrochemical plants, renewables and green hydrogen

items.title: Trade deals should not damage domestic industries on either side, says World Bank President Ajay Banga
items.summary: On the issue of tariffs leading to a new world order, Mr. Banga says tariff should be seen an opportunity to grow

items.title: Gold near Rs 1.8 lakh, silver above Rs 4 lakh—What’s fueling the record rally?
items.summary: Safe-haven buying has increased due to ongoing geopolitical tensions and economic uncertainty. Adding to this, the U.S. The Federal Reserve has voted not to increase interests saying it is very unlikely that rates will increase anytime soon. These signals have supported precious metal prices worldwide.

items.title: Swara Baby Products Private Limited establishes hygiene vertical under “Swara”
items.summary: Swara Baby Products Private Limited has established a new hygiene vertical. This move follows the complete acquisition of KA Enterprises (Hygiene) Private Limited and Solis Hygiene Private Limited. The consolidated group aims for consistent research, development, and quality assurance. This integration seeks to offer clients a comprehensive range of disposable hygiene products.

items.title: Tata Motors CV Q3 FY26 Results: TMCV net profit declines 48% to Rs 1,355 crore; Revenue rises 16%
items.summary: Tata Motors Limited on Thursday reported its financial results for the quarter, with revenue from operations rising but profit declining due to the impact of exceptional items, including provisions related to the new labour code, demerger costs and acquisition-related expenses.

items.title: Airbus expects India's commercial fleet size to triple to 2,250 by 2035
items.summary: Passengers traffic in India will grow at 8.9% per annum by 2035

items.title: Budget session: India is emerging as a ray of hope for the world, says PM Modi
items.summary: PM Modi characterised the President’s address as an expression of confidence from 140 crore citizens that outlined the aspirations of India’s youth

items.title: NPAs hit multi-decadal low as banks stay well-capitalised: Economic Survey
items.summary: The survey highlighted that amid global uncertainty, India’s monetary and financial sectors performed strongly in FY26 (April–December 2025).

items.title: Record high prices pull India gold demand down 11% in 2025: WGC
items.summary: In 2024, the overall gold demand stood at 802.8 tonne

items.title: Raise urea MRP, pay fertilizer subsidy to farmers, says Economic Survey
items.summary: The Economic Survey recommends raising urea prices and directly transferring fertilizer subsidies to farmers to improve agricultural efficiency

items.title: Economic Survey 2025-26 flags high customer acquisition costs in insurance industry
items.summary: Escalating costs due to heavy reliance on expensive intermediary networks despite the digital transformation push as well as administrative costs resulted in increased operating expenses for both life and non-life insurers

items.title: Budget 2026: India’s insolvency law faces its biggest upgrade in a decade
items.summary: India's insolvency law is poised for major changes with the Insolvency and Bankruptcy Code (Amendment) Bill, 2025. This bill aims to speed up the admission of cases and clarify security interests. It also introduces new frameworks like Creditor Initiated Insolvency Resolution Process and Cross-Border Insolvency. Group Insolvency will also be codified.

items.title: World faces copper shortage as AI data centres drive power demand: Economic Survey
items.summary: Copper price has become increasingly volatile due to mine outages in Indonesia, Congo and Chile, raising concerns about supply deficits in the medium to long term, the Survey said.

items.title: Inside India’s new playbook on free trade deals
items.summary: India's trade pacts have grown significantly.  Early deals were small, but now they cover more products and investment.  The country carefully protects key industries like agriculture.  Recent agreements show a willingness to negotiate on new issues like digital trade.  This shows India's increasing experience and confidence in global trade.

items.title: Economic Survey: A word of caution on food self-reliance risk from India's ethanol-blending push
items.summary: India’s push to 20% ethanol blending has shifted production from sugar to food grains like maize.

items.title: Kerala Budget 2026: UDF slams it as ‘political tool filled with empty promises’ ahead of Assembly elections
items.summary: Kerala Budget 2026 : United Democratic Front(UDF) leader V.D. Satheesan said the ruling Left Democratic Front’s (LDF) ‘political manifesto feigned populist, pro-development and welfare to dupe the electorate’

items.title: Global gold demand crosses 5,000 tonne in 2025: WGC
items.summary: Total gold demand hit a new all-time high of 5,002 tonne in 2025, up from 4,961.9 tonne in the previous year, as the investment demand surged to 2,175.3 tonne compared to 1,185.4 tonne in 2024

items.title: Economic Survey 2026 calls for more awareness on health supplements, flags rising lifestyle diseases due to nutrition gap
items.summary: Dietary reforms are now a public health priority for preventing non-communicable diseases. The Economic Survey 2025-26 highlights nutritional deficiencies worsening lifestyle diseases. India's food patterns show excessive cereal consumption and less protective foods. The survey calls for a whole-of-life approach to nutrition, emphasizing quality and diversity. Schools and social media will play key roles in promoting healthy habits.

items.title: Double-decker metro takes shape as Delhi readies first viaduct for train runs
items.summary: Delhi's first double-decker metro viaduct is now ready for trains. This marks a significant step in the city's metro expansion. The viaduct will carry metro trains above and vehicles below. Other double-decker structures are also under construction. This expansion will enhance connectivity across the city.

items.title: Stock markets advance for 3rd day; Sensex rises 221 points, L&T major driver
items.summary: The 50-share NSE Nifty edged higher by 76.15 points or 0.30% to end at 25,418.90; the broader index fell 182.95 points or 0.72% to a low of 25,159.80 in early trade

items.title: India needs stable agri-export policy to achieve $100 billion goal: Economic Survey
items.summary: However, agricultural exports have stagnated between fiscal 2022-23 and 2024-25, even as global agricultural trade rose to $2.4 trillion in 2024 from $2.3 trillion in 2022

items.title: Gold, silver ETFs may soon rival top equity funds in assets on sharp rally

items.title: How the Budget could accelerate India’s critical minerals mission
items.summary: Budget Expectation 2026: India is aggressively pursuing critical mineral security through its National Critical Mineral Mission, aiming to build a domestic value chain for lithium, rare earths, and other strategic minerals. The nation is focusing on both mining and recycling to ensure supply chain resilience and foster industrial leadership in emerging technologies.

These moves are part of a strategy to become a global carrier. Deliveries for the new aircraft are planned over the coming years.

items.title: Gillette India profit jumps on demand for grooming products
items.summary: Gillette India's third-quarter profit jumped about 37% on ‍Thursday, as demand stayed ​robust for its staple men's grooming products, ⁠including shaving razors and creams.

items.title: Composition of household financial savings has undergone a significant shift over the past decade: Economic Survey
items.summary: The household ownership share of deposits has decreased, while that of pension and insurance assets has remained almost unchanged over the period from FY19 to FY24

items.title: Economic Survey 2025-26: Southern states leading on green ease of biz
items.summary: Economic Survey 2026: Tamil Nadu, Kerala, and Andhra Pradesh are pioneering sustainable industrial growth, proving economic progress and environmental care can go hand-in-hand.  These states are integrating green initiatives with business reforms, boosting ease of doing business while championing renewable energy and pollution control.  Digital governance and streamlined processes are key to their success.

items.title: Economic Survey 2025-26 urges policy action to raise women’s labour participation
items.summary: The Economic Survey 2025-26 highlighted the need to increase inclusivity, noting that one way to do so is by encouraging more women to enter male-dominated STEM fields

items.title: Economic Survey 2026: Ban advertising of ultra-processed foods from 6 am-11 pm
items.summary: India faces a growing challenge with ultra-processed foods. The Economic Survey highlights rising obesity, especially in children. It proposes banning advertisements for these foods from morning to night. Restrictions on marketing infant milk are also suggested. This aims to curb unhealthy eating habits and improve public health across the nation.

items.title: Economic Survey 2025-26: Centre remains well on track to achieve 4.4% fiscal deficit target for FY26
items.summary: According to the survey, the central government's fiscal trajectory stands out for combining consolidation with sustained public investment, earning three sovereign rating upgrades this year

items.title: Government needs a startup mindset, merely making rules isn't enough: Economic Survey
items.summary: Under such an approach, the state acts before certainty emerges, structures risk rather than avoiding it, learns systematically from experimentation, and corrects course without paralysis, the Economic Survey said.

items.title: Economic Survey pitches climate-resilient, market-linked reforms to boost farm incomes
items.summary: The survey emphasizes strengthening agriculture through reforms, climate-resilient practices, and private sector involvement. The sector, crucial for economic growth and employment, aims to increase productivity and sustainability while addressing challenges like climate change and water scarcity.

items.title: Economic Survey calls for proactive reforms to attract foreign investment
items.summary: India needs a strong plan to attract more foreign investment. The Economic Survey highlights the need for proactive reforms and targeted strategies. Engaging directly with global companies and offering reliable incentives are crucial. A single empowered center will make India a credible production hub. Sustaining FDI inflows amidst global uncertainty requires policy stability and aggressive investor engagement.

items.title: Economic Survey 2025-26 advocates minimum per-task earnings for gig workers
items.summary: The gig economy continues to expand rapidly, yet income volatility remains a key issue, creating obstacles to credit access. Financial inclusion for gig workers also trails behind; they face limited 'thin-file' credit options, which continue to raise concerns

items.title: Economic Survey FY26: Energy transition should align with growth, security, institutional preparedness
items.summary: India's upcoming decade demands a pragmatic energy strategy. The focus is on balancing growth and security with renewable energy expansion. Dispatchable power remains crucial for industrial and social development. Strengthening transmission, distribution, and storage is key. India's international stance will emphasize predictable finance and technology flows. The nation is already boosting renewables and energy efficiency.

items.title: Nvidia, Microsoft, Amazon in talks to invest up to $60 billion in OpenAI: Report
items.summary: Nvidia, an existing investor whose chips power OpenAI’s AI models, is in talks to invest up ​to $30 billion, The Information said

items.title: Economic Survey 2026: How Nashik luggage ecosystem beat European hubs
items.summary: India's manufacturing prowess hinges on industrial clusters, not isolated factories, according to the Economic Survey 2025-26. The Nashik Samsonite success story highlights how scale, supply chains, and skills converge. The survey advocates for upgrading cluster strategy with a focus on scale, institutional agility, and private sector execution to boost exports and innovation.

items.title: Rising exports reflective of acceptance of India-made cars across global markets: Economic Survey
items.summary: The Survey stated that the automobile industry has recorded nearly 33% growth in production over the last decade

items.title: Economic Survey 2026: Livestock, fisheries drive new growth story in agriculture
items.summary: India's agriculture sector is central to future growth. The Economic Survey shows a shift towards value addition in livestock, fisheries, and horticulture. These allied activities are driving farm incomes and rural livelihoods. Foodgrain production continues to rise, ensuring food security. Horticulture is a bright spot, with India leading in several global productions.

items.title: Economic Survey 2026: Ethanol push risks squeezing pulses, oilseeds
items.summary: India's ethanol program has saved billions in foreign exchange. However, government policies favoring maize for ethanol are pushing farmers away from vital pulses and oilseeds. This shift raises serious concerns about the nation's food security and nutritional needs. The Economic Survey highlights this growing tension between energy self-reliance and food stability.

items.title: MIC Electronics bags ₹114 crore project to set up Common Facility Centre in Chhattisgarh
items.summary: The project will span 10 months and involve all aspects from design and engineering to procurement, construction, installation, testing, commissioning, and preparation for ongoing operations

items.title: Economic Survey 2025-26: Industry experts hail India's GDP growth driven by domestic demand
items.summary: The Economic Survey highlights that India remains the fastest-growing major economy for the fourth consecutive year. The survey's insights show both the resilience and potential of various sectors in India.

items.title: Economic Survey 2026: India's civil aviation sector on sustained growth trajectory, says Survey
items.summary: India's aviation sector is soaring. Passenger numbers are rising, and airports are expanding. The nation aims to become a global aviation hub. More airports are being built, and air cargo is increasing. This growth signals strong economic connectivity. Opportunities exist in manufacturing, training, and leasing. Aviation services are vital for mobility and cargo.

items.title: Economic Survey 2025-26: Labour codes implementation to play key rule in supporting formal employment
items.summary: India has recorded significant employment growth in recent years, supported by structural reforms, tax rationalisation, and a sustained focus on skill development, it noted

items.title: India to unveil incentives for lithium, nickel processing, sources say
items.summary: India is set to boost its electric vehicle ambitions. The government will soon offer incentives for companies to build lithium and nickel processing plants. This move aims to increase output and meet growing demand for essential minerals. A 15% capital subsidy will be provided for eligible projects starting April 2026.

items.title: Indian markets offer value as Budget to keep fiscal path intact: Madhusudan Kela
items.summary: Market veteran Madhusudan Kela anticipates continued fiscal discipline despite a revenue gap. He highlights opportunities in market corrections, noting that individual stocks are becoming attractive after a period of consolidation. Kela also points to the strength of corporate India and sees potential in smaller companies for long-term investors. Investors are encouraged to focus on selective, long-term opportunities.

items.title: Nvidia boss hopeful of China allowing chip sales
items.summary: "I'm hoping... the Chinese government would allow Nvidia to sell (the) H200, so they have to decide, and I'm looking forward to a favourable decision," Huang said

items.title: India-EU FTA strategic signal to US, but gains hinge on efficiency: Nobel laureate Abhijit Banerjee
items.summary: Nobel laureate Abhijit Banerjee calls the India-EU free trade pact a strategic alignment. He believes it signals to the US that India and Europe do not need America as much as it thinks. However, Banerjee cautions that the deal will only bring benefits if India significantly boosts its efficiency and logistics.

items.title: Economic Survey backs voluntary crop diversification over MSP tweaks
items.summary: The Economic Survey proposes voluntary crop diversification instead of changing minimum support prices or reducing procurement. This strategy aims to align farm support with consumption patterns and national self-reliance. Savings from better stock management can fund attractive alternatives for farmers to grow crops like pulses, oilseeds, and maize. This approach protects food security and boosts farmer incomes.

items.title: Economic Survey pitches for correction of inverted duties, lowering logistics costs
items.summary: Enhancing export competitiveness key to a robust currency amid the rising challenges of global fragmentation; FDI flow needs to be maintained as it is the most stable source of capital inflows

items.title: India's aviation fleet to triple in size in 10 years' time, Airbus says
items.summary: Indian aviation: Despite its size, India’s aviation market remains underpenetrated. Air travel stands at just 0.13 trips per person, far below levels seen in comparable regions, Jürgen Westermeier, Airbus president and managing director for India and South Asia, told news agencies.

items.title: Economy projected to grow at 6.8 to 7.2% in FY2027: Economic Survey
items.summary: “The outlook, therefore, is one of steady growth amid global uncertainty, requiring caution, but not pessimism,” said the pre-Budget document

items.title: Bank deposits shrink in household savings as MFs, equities gain ground: Economic Survey
items.summary: Bank deposits’ share of household financial savings has fallen sharply over a decade, while SIP flows, demat accounts and mutual fund participation hit record highs, the Economic Survey said.

items.title: Economic Survey 2025-26: Steel sector faces challenges of international price disparity, raw material security
items.summary: Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman presented the Economic Survey 2025-26 in the Lok Sabha on January 29, 2026

items.title: RBI defers plan to mandate climate risk disclosures by banks, sources say
items.summary: The Reserve Bank of India has paused plans for banks to disclose climate change risks. This move impacts global efforts towards a low-carbon economy. The proposed rules, discussed since 2022, aimed for banks to report loan portfolio risks and mitigation strategies. Implementation was expected from fiscal year 2027. The central bank cited current priorities and potential costs for corporates.

items.title: Highlights of Economic Survey 2025-26
items.summary: The Survey projected the GDP growth in the range of 6.8 to 7.2% in 2026-27, a tad lower than 7.4% estimated in the current fiscal

items.title: Economic Survey 2026: Access to housing finance grows over the years
items.summary: Access to housing finance has significantly improved. The share of housing loans to GDP reached 11% in FY25, up from 8% in FY15. Outstanding individual housing loans more than tripled in a decade. Demand-side measures and urban initiatives have boosted housing finance and demand. The real estate sector is in a sustained upcycle, driven by household savings and favourable affordability.

items.title: Expanding network of FTAs supports India's trade strategy: Economic Survey
items.summary: To sustain the momentum in India's trade performance amid global economic uncertainties, the country is actively pursuing a diversified trade strategy, the survey said.

items.title: Adani Power Q3 Results: PAT down 18.9% YoY to  ₹2,479 crore; revenue fell 9%
items.summary: Adani Power Q3 Results: Adani Power reported an 18.9% decline in Q3 FY26 net profit at  ₹2,479.58 crore, down from  ₹3,057.21 crore. Revenue fell 8.9% to  ₹12,451 crore. Despite this, the company secured a new 3,200 MW power purchase agreement and maintained robust liquidity.

items.title: Economic survey calls for higher GST slabs for ultra-processed foods to combat childhood obesity
items.summary: The Economic Survey also recommended a potential marketing ban on ultra-processed foods between 6 am and 11 pm across all media platforms

items.title: Agriculture sector faces climate, water challenges despite growth: Economic Survey 2026
items.summary: India's agriculture sector is vital for national development. While growth is evident, challenges like climate change and productivity gaps persist. Reforms in fertilizers, research, irrigation, and crop diversification are essential. Strengthening farmer groups and digital platforms will boost transparency and access. Expanding high-growth areas like horticulture and dairy will drive inclusive economic development and job creation.

items.title: Economy Survey proposes QCO framework aligned to industry readiness
items.summary: Overly narrow transition periods can unintentionally burden MSMEs that the QCOs are meant to support

items.title: Economic Survey calls for urea price hike, direct cash transfer to farmers
items.summary: Economic Survey: The proposed shift from input subsidy to income support aims to correct a three-decade-old imbalance in fertiliser use that is degrading soil quality and undermining crop yields, the document, tabled in Parliament on Thursday, stated.

items.title: Economic Survey presents three global market scenarios; benchmarks the worst to the 2008 global financial crisis
items.summary: The Economic Survey 2025-26 highlights significant global economic vulnerabilities, including possible crises worse than the 2008 financial collapse. However, it notes that India will remain better off than most other countries.

items.title: Adani Power Q3 Results: Cons profit falls 19% YoY to Rs 2,480 crore, revenue down 9%
items.summary: Adani Power has announced its December quarter results. The company's consolidated net profit saw a significant 19% increase. This rise in profit is a positive development for the energy giant. However, revenue from operations experienced a slight decrease. Investors will be watching closely for future performance trends.

items.title: Kerala Budget 2026: ₹1,182 crore allocated for roads, bridges and highway development
items.summary: In his Budget speech, Kerala Finance Minister K.N. Balagopal said 898 km of State highways have been upgraded to four lanes and 3,193 km to two lanes. Besides, 52 km  of district roads have been developed into four lanes and 10,953 km into two lanes.

items.title: From multibaggers to laggards: 12 FY25 stars plunge up to 55% in FY26
items.summary: Here are the stocks that standout as multibaggers in FY25—rallying more than 100%—but have since slipped into the laggards’ camp in FY26.

items.title: Tesla invests $2 billion in Musk's xAI and reiterates Cybercab production starts this year
items.summary: Tesla said on Wednesday it will invest $2 billion in CEO Elon Musk’s AI company xAI

items.title: L&T’s confidence on order inflow comforts, but strong finish to FY26 hinges on execution
items.summary: Strong infrastructure-led order inflows lift visibility and stock sentiment, but weak execution and Middle East exposure remain key risks as L&amp;T chases revenue growth and margin stability.

items.title: Rupee punches below its weight as fundamentals clash with global headwinds, economic survey says
items.summary: The Economic Survey 2025–26 says the rupee is undervalued and “punching below its weight” despite India’s strong growth, controlled inflation and solid balance sheets. While the currency hit a record low near Rs 92 per dollar amid foreign outflows and global uncertainty.

items.title: Economic Survey 2026: Squeeze the 'orange' for more juice from India's concert economy
items.summary: India's Economic Survey 2025-26 highlights the 'Orange Economy,' emphasizing live entertainment and concerts as significant growth drivers. The report identifies the concert economy's potential to boost urban services, tourism, and employment, while also noting existing bottlenecks like venue shortages and regulatory hurdles that need addressing for India to scale up this sector.

items.title: Economic Survey 2026: Why Gold matters now more than ever for Indian economy?
items.summary: The Economic Survey notes gold's resurgence in India as a strategic asset amidst global instability, with prices rising sharply due to geopolitical tensions and a weaker dollar. This increase has influenced inflation dynamics and bolstered the country's foreign exchange reserves.

items.title: SET looks beyond fiction, backs global reality formats for weekday growth
items.summary: Sony Entertainment Television is shifting its focus to international reality shows for weekday programming. This strategy aims to attract more male viewers and premium advertisers. The channel is leveraging global formats like Wheel of Fortune to fill a weekday gap.

items.title: Centre remains well on track to achieve 4.4 pc fiscal deficit target for FY26: Survey
items.summary: India's government is set to achieve its fiscal deficit goal of 4.4 percent of GDP this financial year.  This achievement follows a period of fiscal consolidation and increased public investment.  The nation has seen three sovereign rating upgrades.  Markets have responded positively to the government's commitment to fiscal discipline.  This positive trend is expected to continue.

items.title: Gold and silver prices won’t lose their glitter just yet
items.summary: Gold and silver prices are expected to rise, driven by safe-haven demand amid global uncertainties even as global commodity prices are set to soften in FY27 due to lower crude oil prices and modest growth. This divergence impacts India's inflation and credit. High gold prices are boosting personal loans, especially against jewellery. India's imports remain dominated by petroleum and gold.

items.title: Survey seeks insolvency revamp, simpler tax to boost corporate bond demand
items.summary: The regulators have taken several measures over the years to deepen the corporate bond market, but coordinated and phased reforms are needed to further strengthen it and lower the cost of credit for Indian companies, the survey said.

items.title: What leaders often misunderstand about loyalty: It’s not something that arrives on cue
items.summary: Should we expect the most recent customers or students to be the most deeply engaged? Experience suggests otherwise. Put it down to human behaviour. In a world fixated on real-time metrics and instant feedback, we should remember that the deepest and most durable loyalty could take long to form.

items.title: Amazon layoffs: India-based employees among those expected to be hit as e-commerce giant slashes 16,000 jobs—details
items.summary: Initial reports about the latest round of job cuts had not provided specifics about the geographies and departments that are likely to be affected, but now, internal communications from the e-commerce giant has shed some light on the same.

items.title: Airtel partners Adobe to offer Express Premium access free to 360 mn customers
items.summary: Bharti Airtel on Thursday said it will provide free access to Adobe Express Premium to 360 million customers, enabling them to create high-quality social assets, marketing materials, short videos, and design other content.

items.title: Economic Survey 2026 Highlights: From gems & jewellery to textiles, key sectors impacted by Trump tariffs
items.summary: On January 29, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman presented the Economic Survey for FY 2025-26, noting a shift in Indian exports from the US to other regions like the Middle East and Europe, amidst a decline in US demand, especially in the gems and jewellery sector.

items.title: Economic Survey 2025-26: 'Frequent policy changes at export front disrupt supply chains; markets once lost hard to regain'
items.summary: It is possible to stabilise domestic availability and prices while enabling farmers to tap global markets for better incomes, the Survey noted

items.title: Snap doubles down on smart glasses with new independent unit
items.summary: Known for its Snapchat messaging app and ‌animated filters, Snap has been doubling down on AR

items.title: Economic Survey 2026: Agriculture key to achieving Viksit Bharat
items.summary: The overall recommendations in the farm sector do not offer anything innovative or any suggestions to practically plug the challenges when some of those repeated advisories are not getting fructified in terms of policy measures

items.title: Eco Survey: Pharma focus turns to value, innovation over volumes
items.summary: India's pharma sector is moving towards high-value products like complex generics and biosimilars. The medical devices industry is also growing, with exports reaching new heights. Advanced manufacturing technologies are key to this expansion. India is a major global supplier of vaccines and is increasingly producing sophisticated medical equipment. This marks a significant step in high-tech medical manufacturing.

items.title: Economic Survey 2026: Is India’s Income Tax department moving from coercive enforcement?
items.summary: India's Economic Survey 2025-26 reveals a shift in tax strategy, emphasizing the NUDGE model. This data-driven approach uses behavioral prompts to enhance voluntary compliance, reducing reliance on audits and litigation.

items.title: Piramal Pharma posts ‘muted’ Q3, impacted by 9% dip in CDMO revenues
items.summary: Posts a consolidated loss of ₹136 crore in the quarter

items.title: Economic Survey 2026 forecasts 6.8-7.2% growth for 2026-27
items.summary: The Economic Survey 2025-26 projects India’s GDP growth at 6.8–7.2% for 2026-27, following an estimated 7.4% in the current fiscal. Medium-term growth potential is raised to 7%, up from 6.5% in 2022-23, reflecting the cumulative impact of recent policy reforms.

items.title: Q4 earnings, Budget and trade deals seen as key market triggers: Aman Chowhan
items.summary: Indian markets are waiting for a boost as recent earnings met expectations but did not attract foreign investors. The upcoming March quarter earnings will be crucial for growth trends. The Union Budget and global trade talks are also key factors. Midcap stocks are showing improved risk-reward. Sectors like pharma, chemicals, and export-oriented companies are poised for growth.

items.title: Digit Insurance disburses moisture index-based parametric insurance to Rajasthan farmers
items.summary: The claim has been paid to farmers in over 30 villages in Tonk and will benefit 500 farmers

items.title: Fix the freebies, Economic Survey 2026 warns and tells how
items.summary: The Economic Survey 2025-26 highlights the rapid expansion of unconditional cash transfers (UCTs) in Indian States, noting their significant impact on beneficiaries' incomes. However, it warns that their scale and persistence strain State finances, potentially crowding out crucial growth-enhancing public investments and leading to fiscal rigidity without consistently improving long-term outcomes.

items.title: Snap Inc. spins off Specs smartglasses business into separate subsidiary
items.summary: Snap Inc. says restructuring provides operational focus, enables potential minority investment in business

items.title: Economic Survey 2026: India-US trade talks to be concluded this year
items.summary: Trade talks between New Delhi and Washington are still underway and negotiations are expected to be completed this year, a development that could help reduce external uncertainties, the Economic Survey 2026 said.

items.title: Economic Survey: Deeper financialisation drives India’s housing demand as loans hit Rs 37 lakh cr
items.summary: India’s housing sector has seen rapid financialisation, with individual housing loans tripling over the past decade to over ₹37 lakh crore in March 2025, now accounting for more than 11% of GDP. The sector contributes around 7% to annual GVA, linking strongly to construction and financial services.

items.title: Crores of children at risk from the food you are feeding them, Economic Survey 2026 warns
items.summary: Economic Survey 2026: India's Economic Survey 2026 flags a major health crisis: rising obesity. Unhealthy diets, ultra-processed foods, and inactive lifestyles are driving this trend across all ages. This surge in obesity is linked to serious diseases like diabetes and heart ailments. The government is implementing strategies to tackle this growing concern through awareness and regulation.

items.title: Economic Survey 2026: India's recent trade triumphs to fuel its growth powerhouse
items.summary: India's new trade deals aim to boost manufacturing for resilience. The Economic Survey highlights that factories, not just services, build a strong economy. Recent agreements, like the one with the European Union, focus on expanding manufactured exports. This strategic shift seeks to enhance India's production capabilities and global competitiveness.

items.title: Economic Survey 2026: India’s strong growth streak comes with a ‘wrinkle in the ointment’
items.summary: India is set for back-to-back years of over 7% growth, marking one of its strongest macroeconomic runs in decades, according to the Economic Survey 2025-26. The Survey highlights a “wrinkle in the ointment”: despite robust growth, the global system no longer rewards economic success with currency stability, capital inflows, or strategic insulation.

items.title: FM Nirmala Sitharaman tables Economic Survey 2025-26 in both Lok Sabha and Rajya Sabha
items.summary: The survey is tabled ahead of the Union Budget and presents a backdrop for the policy actions to be taken in the next financial year

items.title: Economic Survey flags savings, manufacturing boost to cut cost of capital
items.summary: The Economic Survey 2025-26 warned high capital costs constrain investment, urges reforms to boost domestic savings, exports and manufacturing competitiveness.

items.title: Economic Survey reveals challenges for steel sector on price disparities, raw material security
items.summary: India's steel sector, a pillar of industrial growth, is navigating international price differences and securing raw materials. Despite being the second-largest crude steel producer, the nation became a net steel importer in FY26 due to low global prices. Efforts are underway to boost domestic coking coal production and support specialty steel manufacturing through a PLI scheme.

items.title: Economic Survey 2025-26: Need to improve India’s PPP frameworks
items.summary: India's Public-Private Partnerships require a strategic shift. The focus must move from individual projects to building robust markets. Reducing uncertainty and broadening the definition of infrastructure are key. This evolution is crucial for India's growth and its vision for Viksit Bharat @2047.

items.title: Economic Survey 2026: Global markets are giving India-made cars a nod of acceptance as exports rise
items.summary: Economic Survey 2026: India's auto industry is hitting new heights, reflecting international confidence in homegrown vehicles. In FY25, exports surged past 5.3 million units, fueled by impressive double-digit growth. The sector has ramped up production by nearly a third over the past ten years, thanks to government initiatives propelling electric vehicle adoption.

items.title: Brandman Retail targets ₹400 cr revenue in 2 yrs
items.summary: Brandman aims to defend the financial performance by leveraging its 23 per cent EBITDA margin through an asset-light, highly scalable business model

items.title: Economic Survey urges strengthening of India’s long-term capital markets
items.summary: The Survey noted that the corporate bond markets were shallow and illiquid, securitisation was limited, municipal bonds were underdeveloped, and pension and insurance funds remain conservative investors due to regulatory and cultural inertia

items.title: Canara Bank Q3 Results: Profit rises 26% YoY to Rs 5,155 crore; NII up 1%
items.summary: Canara Bank Q3 Results: Canara Bank posted a strong operational performance in the quarter, with operating profit rising 16% year-on-year to Rs 9,119 crore. Business growth remained healthy, as global business, deposits and advances each grew 13%. Credit expansion was driven by retail, agriculture and MSME segments, with retail loans up 31%.

items.title: Economic Survey 2026: India to tap education internationalisation to retain talent, attract global migrants
items.summary: The Economic Survey 2026 highlighted that India is actively positioning itself as a global education hub, attracting international students through policy reforms and initiatives like 'Study in India.' The nation aims to retain talent and encourage skilled migration by diversifying academic offerings and enhancing student mobility, fostering international collaboration.

items.title: Economic Survey 2026: A clever hack is rewriting India’s tax playbook
items.summary: Economic Survey 2026: India's tax administration is shifting towards a data-driven, behavioral approach, utilizing "nudges" to enhance compliance and reduce litigation. The NUDGE framework, focusing on timely information and gentle prompts, has successfully encouraged voluntary corrections, leading to significant increases in declared assets, income, and tax collections.

items.title: PE firm InvAscent writes bigger cheques in pharma as rising costs reset capital needs
items.summary: This comes on the back of increased investor interest in the pharma and healthcare sectors, driven by higher income spends, expanding healthcare coverage and growing medical tourism

items.title: Economic Survey: Over 96 lakh houses delivered under PMAY-U as affordable housing demand rises
items.summary: India's PMAY-U has sanctioned 122.06 lakh houses, with 96.02 lakh completed, addressing urban housing shortages for low- and middle-income households. The Economic Survey 2025-26 highlights informality's structural role in cities, providing low-cost housing and absorbing labor.  Affordable housing demand is projected to reach 30 million units by 2030, with government interventions strengthening housing access and urban labor integration.

items.title: Rising exports reflective of acceptance of India-made cars across global markets: Eco Survey
items.summary: Overall, the industry has recorded nearly 33 per cent growth in production over the last decade (from FY15 to FY25), it added

items.title: PM Modi urges manufacturers to focus on quality, not just market expansion, post India-EU FTA
items.summary: The second quarter of current century has begun on a highly positive note, says Modi, adding that a self-confident India has become a ray of hope for the world today

items.title: Hindustan Copper, National Aluminium drive Nifty Metal to a new peak; gains over 2.4%
items.summary: Hindustan Copper surged 19% while National Aluminium and Jindal Steel also gained, driven by rising metal prices and a weaker US dollar. The Nifty Metal index climbed to a record high, reflecting strong investor sentiment amid geopolitical tensions.

items.title: Delhi high court summons Priya Kapur, others on Rani Kapur’s plea to cancel family trust
items.summary: The Delhi high court has also issued summons to 23 other defendants named by Rani Kapur in her plea. These include her grandchildren Samaira Kapur and Kiaan Kapur, children of the late Sunjay Kapur and his former wife, actress Karisma Kapoor.

items.title: LT Foods reports 24% revenue growth in nine months despite tariff pressures
items.summary: For the third quarter alone, the New Delhi-based FMCG company posted revenue of ₹2,812 crore, up 23 per cent year-on-year

items.title: India’s long-run challenge is to transform into a surplus generating economy: Economic Survey
items.summary: Economies that generate sustained external surpluses can finance investment cheaply and stably at home

items.title: PSU banks, power stocks still offer upside ahead of Budget: Neeraj Dewan
items.summary: Investor sentiment remains cautious ahead of the Union Budget, with FII outflows a key concern. Market expert Neeraj Dewan suggests selective buying in infrastructure, capital goods, and PSU banks, noting attractive valuations. He remains constructive on power T&D and sees opportunities in power generation, while advising caution on NBFCs and recommending long-term accumulation in real estate.

items.title: Andy Mukherjee: Why India’s budget-makers can’t ignore Japan’s nervous market for government bonds
items.summary: Turmoil in Japan’s bond market is a reminder of how swiftly investors punish fiscal slippage. India’s shift to a debt-level fiscal target with its next budget will be watched closely by investors. New Delhi has much to spend on but not much budgetary headroom.

items.title: Economic Survey 2025-26: Ongoing trade talks with U.S. expected to conclude during the year
items.summary: The global conditions translate into external uncertainties rather than immediate macroeconomic stress, the survey said

items.title: ABB gives confident outlook for 2026, launches $2 billion buyback
items.summary: Swiss engineering group ABB reported fourth-quarter earnings exceeding forecasts and announced a new $2 billion share buyback, expressing confidence for 2026. The company is benefiting from the AI boom, strong demand in rail and marine sectors, and achieved record full-year orders and revenue. ABB aims for further growth and margin improvement by 2026.

items.title: Economic Survey 2026: India’s trade buffers blunt the blow of Trump tariffs
items.summary: Economic Survey 2026: India's exports show resilience against increasing US tariffs.  Structural reforms and policy measures have boosted growth.  Foreign exchange reserves provide a strong buffer.  Diversified trade agreements with the UK, Oman, New Zealand, and the EU support export momentum.  The undervalued rupee cushions tariff impacts and controls inflation.  India's trade strategy is adapting to global shifts.

items.title: Economic Survey 2026: India’s future cities must make life easier, not just bigger
items.summary: India's future cities will prioritize saving time and boosting creativity. The Economic Survey 2025-26 suggests designing urban spaces for easier living and economic growth. This includes rethinking streets as social hubs and fostering creative zones. The focus shifts to productivity, dignity, and quality of life for all residents. Governance reforms will empower citizens in decision-making.

items.title: Govt notifies coking coal as ‘critical mineral’ to cut steel import dependence
items.summary: India has declared coking coal a Critical and Strategic Mineral. This move aims to reduce reliance on imports for steelmaking. The government's decision will expedite mining clearances and policy support. It recognizes coking coal's vital role in national mineral security and the steel sector. This reform is set to boost private investment and create jobs.

items.title: Economic Survey 2026: Rupee punching below its weight. Why does it not 'hurt'?
items.summary: The Economic Survey 2026 said the rupee underperformed in 2025 and is trading below levels suggested by India’s economic fundamentals. It noted that a weaker rupee does not hurt for now, as it helps soften the impact of higher US tariffs on Indian exports and poses no immediate inflation risk from costlier crude imports.

items.title: How used car buying platforms are prioritising customer experience in 2025-26
items.summary: From clearer pre-sale decisions to stronger post-purchase protection, customer experience is becoming the real differentiator in online used car buying

items.title: Economic Survey 2026: FY27 inflation likely to be higher but not a concern - Key reasons explained
items.summary: The Economic Survey 2026 predicts India's inflation will be higher in FY27 than FY26, but remains within the RBI's target. FY26 saw headline inflation average 1.7%, with projections for FY27 at 4.0%. The report emphasizes that inflation is not expected to pose macroeconomic concerns.
